This is a PoC that interacts with only AAVE and SOLANA. To get an idea of how this PoC can be matured refer to the Github tamermint@github

Why KYC? And Why it's broken?

Web2 KYC depends on aggregation of all identification points for availing service e.g. opening a bank account in India requires that you provide multiple identity documents such as Driving License, National Identity Document, Address Proof, Biometrics etc. At any point of time, the security of your identity documents is guaranteed by a financial institution which may or may not be capable to guarantee secure custody during a data breach.
Web2 KYC depends on use of significant PII documents to guarantee proof-of-personhood and residence. At any point of time, your entire ID may or may not be exposed while data is stored on a server somewhere. We need to think about not just how to protect against breaches, but how better the unit of ID is when there's a breach i.e. we need a way to ensure our id requires trust minimized assumptions, easy proving capabilities and compatible with decentralized validation services
Hello Web3. All you need is transaction data, presented as a document that reflects your activity and generates a proof that is sufficiently valid to the instituition without you needing to provide more than what is necessary to receive a service.
Quadratic reputation scoring is a mechanism to generate a weighted score based on the number of "legit" activities on-chain. You might ask "Hey, does that mean my reputation score can tend to infinity if I just keep being legit?". No Sir, your reputation has a cap and decays over time if you don't have a lot of activity. However, your graph is a unique document at a point of time (block time) that proves your capability as a genuine requester.
Refer to the disclaimer above for more information
